Vulcan Forged - REKT
12/13/2021

Vulcan Forged - CEX - REKT

Four cases in ten days. $140M gone from Vulcan Forged. "Compromised keys" are so hot right now.

Ascendex - REKT
12/12/2021

Ascendex - REKT

Two CEX rekt in one week. Why do we see more “compromised keys” in uncertain markets? $77.7M gone from Ascendex.

MORE

8ight Finance - REKT
12/08/2021

8ight Finance - REKT

Although this is our first story taking place on the Harmony chain, there’s nothing new about the protocol. Another Olympus fork, another set of "compromised keys". $1.75M gone.

MORE

Sushiswap Scandal
12/06/2021

Sushiswap - leak

Internal arguments, fired whistleblowers, and dismissed developers have brought dark times upon the once popular “community-led” decentralised exchange. How did it go so wrong for Sushiswap?

MORE

BitMart - REKT
12/05/2021

CeFi - BitMart - REKT

Is CeFi any safer than DeFi? If not, why use it? BitMart has lost $196M, placing it at number 2 on our leaderboard. Will they commit to refunding their users?

MORE

REKT:TV - Ape Tax
12/03/2021

ape tax - rektTV

Ape Season is here, and Ape Tax must be paid. Just as relevant as when it was first published in December of 2020, our second major video release is an animated assessment of our online gambling culture.

Badger - REKT
12/02/2021

Badger - REKT

rekt roadkill. $120M taken in a front-end attack, placing Badger at number four on the leaderboard. rekt repeats; "infinite approval means unlimited trust."

MonoX - REKT

MonoX - REKT

rekt by their own token. Mono X lost $31M via a price manipulation of their recently launched $MONO. How did two audits not prevent this?

Snowdog - REKT
11/26/2021

Snowdog - Avalanche - REKT

A “game theory experiment” or a new breed of rug pull? ~$18M snapped up by just the first two transactions of Snowdog’s buyback. Was it luck or inside information that led the top dogs to success?

Uniswap

It’s not all rainbows and unicorns in Uniswap V3. A recent study suggests that ~50% of UNI V3 LPs are losing money.

Airdrop

It’s airdrop season. Tokenised responsibility is falling thick and fast. But do users want to govern, or do they prefer to speculate?
